text: Walter S. Gurnee (March 9, 1813 â€“ April 18, 1903) was an American politician. He was the Mayor of Chicago from 1851 through 1853. The town Gurnee, Illinois is named after him. He was a Democrat. Gurnee was born on March 9, 1813 in Haverstraw, New York. He was raised in Michigan and in Chicago. He was never married and had no children. Gurnee died on April 18, 1903 in New York City, New York from natural causes, aged 90. ==References== ==Other websites== *Village of Gurnee, IL history page *1st Inaugural speech at Chicago Public Library *2nd Inaugural speech at Chicago Public Library Category:1813 births Category:1903 deaths Category:Mayors of Chicago Category:Politicians from New York (state) Category:Politicians from Michigan Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians
title: Walter S. Gurnee
